definition: firmly and solidly, rigidly conventional or old-fashioned, a hand tool consisting of two straight arms at right angles, make square
details:
adverb
- firmly and solidly
= example: firmly and solidly
= synonyms: squarely
- in a square shape
= example: in a square shape
= synonyms: squarely
- in a straight direct way
= example: in a straight direct way
= synonyms: squarely
adjective
- rigidly conventional or old-fashioned
= synonyms: straight
- having four equal sides and four right angles or forming a right angle
= example: having four equal sides and four right angles or forming a right angle
- characterized by honesty and fairness
= synonyms: straight
- providing abundant nourishment
= synonyms: solid, hearty, substantial, satisfying
- without evasion or compromise
= synonyms: straight
- leaving no balance
noun
- a hand tool consisting of two straight arms at right angles
- any artifact having a shape similar to a plane geometric figure with four equal sides and four right angles
= example: any artifact having a shape similar to a plane geometric figure with four equal sides and four right angles
- an open area at the meeting of two or more streets
= synonyms: public square
- a formal and conservative person with old-fashioned views
= synonyms: square toes
- someone who doesn't understand what is going on
= synonyms: lame
- the product of two equal terms
= synonyms: second power
- (geometry) a plane rectangle with four equal sides and four right angles
= synonyms: foursquare
- something approximating the shape of a square
verb
- make square
= synonyms: square up
- raise to the second power
- turn the oar, while rowing
= synonyms: feather
- turn the paddle
= synonyms: feather
- position so as to be square
= example: position so as to be square
- pay someone and settle a debt
= example: pay someone and settle a debt
- be compatible with
= example: be compatible with
- cause to match, as of ideas or acts
